reviews.text: I love it here! It's a lovely huge park, great for bringing dogs and small children. There's a whole beach dedicated for doggies to play at! The Maritime Museum, The HRR McMillan Space Center, and the MOV all are in this park! It's a must see for all tourists in Vancouver. You can catch a water taxi across to Downtown from Vanier Park. My only complaint is the goose poop, look out for that! Geese love the park just as much as we do, so watch out!
Vanier Park is a pretty non descript park. Nothing too special but great views of the downtown and the water. We had our wedding ceremony here for personal reasons so i am forced to give it 5 stars.

Vanier Park located off Cornwall Street, Vancouver BC. One can find the City of Vancouver Archives, the Museum of Vancouver, the Maritime Museum and plenty of walkways along the water. Beautiful vistas await your visit.

Great place to go for a walk,  jog,  run etc. The view of the skyline is stunning and the best part is the beach.  There's also a museum and sky observatory nearby. One of the best places to hang around near downtown Vancouver.
Beautiful location! Grassy area and seawall for walkers and cyclists nearby.
An excellent way to commute. Combine it with transit and car-share, and you’ll never need a private car!
No concerts quite yet. There is dance classes in the studio at the back

My kids enjoyed the camp, but after seeing the performance it was obvious they had little control of the children. When spoken to about this, they were blaming the children instead of their lack of control. Never taking them back.
Is naist they have light for gristmas 🎄🎄
I have had several performances here. The sound is good and the sound technicians are so experts and nice. They did a great job ob my last performance playing Violin with Piano.
Used the dance studio in the back. Aircon and lots of mirrors for dance practice.
Never get tired of this place always nice to walk around highly recomended.

A wonderful place that I ever seen before 😍👍🤘
Really a nice and peaceful place..
Like,the people, the roads, the states,the communications,
And all of the things is very good

But I don't see anything in my eyes,😉
Just see in many videos and
pictures which is in the social media and internet.😍
I wish if have a chances to get me in here.
Or anyone get me to visit with him I will be waiting for that😋

Thank you for your time to read my pleasure ❤️

Take love from my hard 💘🇧🇩
Stay blessed 💞

This is my second time here. My husband and I took a lovely walk around Stanley Park and walked all the way to Canada Place to view Fly Over Canada right before it was closed for the day. I have to say, it is a one of a kind experience, felt so real, and would love to go as many times as I can. Everywhere we walked there was signs to ensure people stay two meters apart and I couldn't help but take a picture.

Best place. Spend my free time in between classes here during my college time .Always find peace here. Mountains, water, love this place in any weather. Whenever have chance to visit BC again definitely gonna visit this place.🏞

This is a small but mighty walk. A gentle and yet vibrant stroll along the seawall will reinvigorate you. On any given day, snowy, rainy or sunny, you will find people and pets strolling here. Getting fresh air, snapping pics of the birds, planes, seascapes and each other. Refresh your kind with a walk here during these pandemic times.
Lots of available bikes.
Bus No. 5 The only bus route on Robson st.
Great spot for parking mobi bikes. Thank the heavens for this spot. Oh yes!
very safe location
I spoke with Ana about working on future projects and can confirm that she is very professional and an excellent communicator!
Development firm with High Level Standard
Luxury Development and Construction Co.

Definitely the worst nightclub I've been to so far. The coat check is completely a disaster. Three ladies at the coat check and no management at all. They handed away unclaimed coats to random people. The club was a mess. Two fights started in the club, directed out of the door and ended so bad that cops were involved because it went down to assault. The crowd isn't the best to have around. The bars are probably the only spot in the club I wouldn't complain about. Wouldn't recommend.

Updated review for clarity. Wouldn't return. The drink selection was reasonable, lots of weird cocktails. My food was ok, had the cajun chicken burger and it was a thick well cooked peice of real chicken, lots of Frank's, the fries were certainly the best part.
My wife received her first beyond meat burger cold in the middle, the remade one was just warm. The Ceaser salad was a bowl of iceberg lettuce and croutons. The smoked salmon and turkey? platters were no better.

What it comes to is the selection for karaoke, wasn't impressed. Not much for mid nineties north american music. The positive were that the staff were very friendly and prompt.

I don’t recommend this place. First off, the place is small. Second, which is the most important, security guards are the worst ever. Friends literally stepped out for air, then weren’t allowed to come in unless we bribe them with extra money. They were very rude. Really it’s a joke that they forcibly pushed my friends, I really wanted to call police at the time.
Nice layout, lots of places to sit and big dancefloor.

Went with the whole crowd. To be honest, the vibe overall is decent, but the staff was really rude, especially the security guards who really were obnoxious in an unacceptable way. Don’t show me ur attitude, u ain’t doin ur jobs in a professional way. Aboslute thumbs-down
Very convenient location in False Creek Olympic Village.  Can take a scenic bike ride along Science World to Granville Island, then to Kitsilano Beach.
parking is easy, went to pick groceries at save on ... A quiet low key place. I recommend ordering on line... Don't wait in one.

I drive a convertible, Sunday night November 16th on the 9th floor someone cut a hole through my roof and stole basically nothing yet it cost me 150.00 to get the roof patched and it looks like a really bad scar on my roof. I'm a monthly parker thought it was safe place, but in a city that has no consequences for theft I guess we're supposed to say what the hell who cares.

Too expensive for us to actually pay for parking so we just decided not too. It was maybe $9.00 for 30-45 minutes of parking. I wanted to see Seattle for my first time and just don't have a huge amount of money to travel with. It's okay because I usually pass the time when I  travel taking lots of photos.
Safe and well lit. Attendant was there all night.

You can get monthly parking on the roof for $175.  It will take you 3-5 minutes to go up and down.  You can only really exit right out of the garage.  After work hours exiting can be a nightmare.  The staff are cool though, helpful.  Sometimes buns have used it to do drugs or the bathroom though.
7 floors and each one has 2 levels so you can go around and around for 30 min 🤪 Staff there are very nice but if you plan to walk back there from a Seahawks or Mariners Game...do not walk alone.
Gorgeous Christmas lights and delicious food right opposite at Mr Shwarma food truck!! 💕
Great location

The glass roof is very interesting. It gives the station a very vast feel.

Downstairs at platform level, it feels very enclosed.

The elevators severely need updating. They seem fast on the inside, but it can feel extremely slow when waiting for an elevator from the outside.
Awesome station
I enjoy walking down this road.
Nice side street with some outdoor seating and periodic events.
Very old steam clock.  :)
Interesting. Gastown worths the visit bit avoid it during the weekends as it seems a bit dangerous.

This is a very interesting monument located in the heart of Gastown. It was originally built in 1977 it runs on steam and it produces a puff of steam on its top every hour. If you want clear picture you need to be patient, the monument is usually crowded and maybe you can get a cool shot if you wait enough. Also, I would say early in the morning is the best time to try without having to face the crowd.
The first steam clock in the world
At first I didn't understand why it was an attraction at all. But when the whistles go even 15 minutes its really cool.
Plenty of bikes available.
It is very  Good for Riverdale fans  it’s the (wite worm) it’s a very good place for live Music 😁
Always had fun here! Great country bar! It’s small though.

Awesome country bar club. Has live music and awesome atmosphere. Bouncers did not look happy and were a bit rude, you can tell they do not want to speak but it is okay they are doing their job. The cleanliness of the club is okay. The bathrooms are a bit on the ugly side. Does not look like it is really well taken care of.
The country music is good, especially with live performance. The speakers are a bit iffy though. Dance floor is nice and big but can get crowded! This is a nice place to hang out and chill with friends and maybe make some new ones!
Went in friday dec 20th and the coat check girl was so incredibly rude to myself and other customers i watched her yell at a customer who just wanted to get her jacket and leave

Most of the timed gabbys is great. The bartenders inside are fantastic, can be a super great night. It’s just a shame that the bouncers can be so rude and mouthy. Obviously they have a difficult job, but I don’t think it’s polite to be dropping F bombs and screaming at guests when you speak to them the first time. Maybe they were having a bad night, but it was pretty unprofessional and not acceptable for the service industry.

2352.name: Landmark Cinemas St. Catharines, Pen Centre

reviews.text:
Oh they've upgraded! I don't go to the movies a lot and the last time I did, they had those regular boring, uncomfortable seats.

Now it's all different. They've got those fancy recliners with build in cup holders. Going to the movies is luxurious! And the movie was only 5 bucks. Concession is always where they make money, so no surprises there, and we did get snacks. Definitely returning.
We were in a theaterwith power recliners and only 5 rows of seats.  Sound and picture were great and Landmark is enforcing safety protocols to protect their guests.
Laser Ultra seating is amazing! So comfy and very clean - make sure you experience it!
I've been going here since I was a kid. And I still get that nostalgic feeling every time I sit down to watch a movie.
Their new recliner love seats are so great! Felt comfortable with the procedures in place.

2353.name: EB E Broadway at Glen Dr

reviews.text: The only bus stop better than this one is the one right across the street. Top notch.

2354.name: Eastbound E Broadway @ St. George St

reviews.text: If St George and Broadway are where you want to go then you couldn't ask for a better placed bus stop
Near the parking lot by the Shadbolt center it’s where you could find some beautiful maple trees with bright red leaves in autumn. The pictures are taken in mid October 2020.
Good. A lot of people were taking pictures under trees.

Great selection of programs for the kids. A wonderful place to be. Amazing architecture, lots of air and wood. Modern yet feels like home. Lots of waiting areas for the parents who are waiting. A little coffee shop with some standard options is nice to have if you’re desperate. Maybe this could be upgraded with time? The outside space is even more beautiful, lots of nature around.
I used it to park to walk Deer Lake Park.....nice park

Great Centre.  It offers different classes such as Ballet...  A great place to come and see a play.  A good quite place to get some work done.  It can be rented for events also.  You can find a small Café by the main entrance.  Easy to park outside and it also has underground parking.
What a great space for community events with all the amenities included!
Great place for meetings. Clean, organized and equipped.
Future Amazon Office
Saw Vicky chow
Cultural Hub
Very nice and helpful.
Good place to hang out. Has an excellent selection of ticketed events. This is the best club in Vancouver. Best sound system compared to all the other Vancouver clubs. Highly recommend this place.

This place never disappoints. Good music and good crowd. They have one of the better sound systems in the city and have the friendliest staff. Overall, nice establishment for a night out with friends.
cool atmosphere and safe space to let loose and have fun dancing

Went New Years Eve for midnight balloon drop. Paid the $50 ticket beforehand on their site for a line skip, I guess? Nothing was physically included with the ticket, so not sure how it was different than just walking in. Expected it to be packed, and it was, so that wasn’t the issue.

Basically, music was atrocious (I’m 23, so no excuse there). I expected the best of the best for NYE but they didn’t deliver even close to passable. Put bluntly, you need a little more than just alcohol to enjoy this DJ selection. Generic, repetitive, unsatisfying drops, beats and club hits all around. Basically press play and bounce around. Not sure if their mixboard was even connected.

Ended up being an expensive night without the quality music and dancing to back it up. Lack security, extensive drug pushing and open bathrooms. What could go wrong?

Wouldn’t really recommend this to anyone. Had an okay time with friends but would much rather go to Portside or something else that’s at least halfway decent next time.
I have spent too many nights here having way too much fun with friends that I love ✌️

3759.name: Busy Bees Pottery and Arts Studio - Merrillville

reviews.text: I organized a private event at Busy Bee's for my sister's bachelorette party. WE HAD A BLAST!! It was so much fun, and it was pretty easy to do! We did board art, our instructor Debbie was simply wonderful! Lots of laughs! I can't wait to bring my daughter here for her birthday. They have so many activities to pick from, and it's the most AFFORDABLE place around! I'll recommend them to everyone I know!!!
My companion's mother had her birthday gathering here. What a wonderful experience. Enjoyed myself 😊. Highly recommend. Will be back again
Everyone there is so nice and friendly. Prices are excellent! Very clean store! Great atmosphere! Spent 5 hours there creating. Had a blast!
It's a creative person's dream !!! Different mediums to choose from, can't wait to go back with my very artistic daughter & make some lasting memories.  Awesome Idea !!!
This place is AWESOME for any artist!!

3964.name: Mobi Bike Station 0254 - Grandview Bike Lane & Commercial

4347.name: Eastbound E Hastings St @ Campbell Ave

reviews.text: Good congregational worship Will wonderful people. Its a family of God indeed.
A wonderful place to worship God.
Great atmosphere to worship.
Lively.  Friendly. Real people.
Good place to hear the word of God

Just minutes of walk away from the future skytrain station and right next to the creative tech and digital media hub Great Northern Way Campus, the South Flatz will be a 160,000 sq. ft. seven-storey LEED-Gold building that will be home to a vibrant mix of tech companies such as Blackbird Interactive, Finning International, Spaces Co-Working, Samsung, and many more.

Went there the other day to treat myself and get my hair professionally dyed after doing it myself throughout quarantine. Well that was a BIG mistake. The stylist (name starts with a L) was sloppy while applying the dye, even as I was saying that I was having problems with my roots not taking the dye. Despite that she applies it all over, all at the same time. Sure enough my roots come out blond and the tips middle/dark brown. She went ahead and put a darker colour on the roots, however, she did not do so carefully thereby getting some of the dye on my tips. Although I could not tell with the salon lighting and believing people who said it looked good, when I got home and looked carefully I discovered my hair looks like a hot mess. The roots are still lighter than the tips and the colour is blotchy due to the poor application.
UPDATE: Spoke with management and went back to fix the colouring issues. The stylist (name starts with S) was much more professional and applied the colour evenly and fixed the colour inconsistencies. Hair looks so much better!

My 7 year old had the best experience here. Because of COVID, neither mom nor dad weren't able to be by her side. My daughter has high, high anxiety and I was a little curious as to how this was going to work out. They did a phenomenal job. They placed her right by a window and the cut was done really quickly. Very good safety standards and overall a great experience ☺️

I've been going to salon since last December John is great, love my hair cuts by him. He styled my hair for my Christmas party last did an amazing job. Everyone is very friendly at Aura. Front desk girls always helpful when my hair dresser has been away gives me a call to reschedule. Excellent customer service!

First time at Aura, I was assured that all of their stylists were experienced in both men and women cuts. However, upon the completion of my hair cut, I noticed that both sides were extremely uneven and the back was even more choppy than when I came in. Additionally, Jennifer did not ask me about my preferred length before she started. Not only is my hair uneven everywhere, the length ended up being significantly shorter than I anticipated (leaving little room for repair).

Professional setting with polite staff, however the hair cut leaves a lot to be desired.
Went to Jen to get my hair cut before my wedding and she did an amazing job, she is always very polite and professional and always does a great job. She's personable and talented! Thanks Jen!

I'm hesitant to post this review, not because they haven't earned it (they have), but because I don't want to blow my local spots up.
Great dive. Quiet atmosphere, and a community vibe. Love this place
low key neighborhood dive bar. friendly bartenders, and you can order food from the burger joint right next door and they will deliver it to you. cool place.

I was visiting a friend of mine nearby and he said this bar worth to check it out and man! I am glad we stop by! Bartender (Paddy I hope I spell his name right) was really present and friendly. Very interesting guy with coolest mustache I ever seen!
The bartender was great.  You can order in food  from the burger place next door.  Space is small & dimly lit.
Great neighborhood hang out. Stop by on Sunday for classic NES games.

Cleanest place we've ever been during covid. Dropped in at the gym and was pleasantly surprised at how good of a job they do at keeping things clean. From minimizing the amount of people allowed in at a time to having two staff members cleaning everything you use immediately after you leave the station.  Totally awesome, will be back

I liked about this swimming centre me and my friend went there and it's not crowded and also I liked the water slide as well. Good thing that there are life guard around to see if the kids are doing the right thing I felt happy that everything is always there for some of the thing that is so cool
I go here for physiotherapy. Great team. I would recomend them to anyone.
Probably the only swimming pool that is actually for swimming, other pools are usually very warm and super chlorinated. This is the only pool I can swim without having severe rashes.
A great place to bring kids. Change rooms are spacious and facility is clean. Public swim for adults, not convenient and minimal schedule due to all the classes.

Vancouver downtown historic Railway is now discontinued due to Financial constraints. It’s a tram service that operated on weekends 1998 to 2011. For the 2010 Olympic Games the tram was borrowed from Brussels from January 21, 2010 to March 21, 2010 that I’ve learnt that on Wikipedia. I wish the tram still ran today which would be very nice to take a smooth ride.
This is the olympic villiage skitrain.!

In case you miss the future of transportation: ELA (electric autonomous shuttle aka driverless vehicle) the free shuttle was available until Sunday March 3rd,2019.
They were giving people free rides from the parking lot near Olympic station to Manitoba Street near CRAFT beer market

The Canada Line travels to the Olympic Village.

Upon arrival at the Vancouver Airport, we purchased a Compass card as public transportation is excellent.

Taking our luggage with us, we traveled by train. The Compass card is for transportation by bus, water bus, train and sky rail...

We arrived at the Olympic Village, walking towards Whole Foods with luggage and all to buy groceries / water because we had rented an apartment, costing less than staying at a hotel. We took a taxi to the rented apartment with kitchen, washer / dryer, dish washer and started to live as Canadians...

When we stepped out of the Canada Line Station on West 6th Ave at Cambie Street, we found ourselves in one of the fastest changing neighborhoods in Vancouver, a stretch of waterfront on the Southeast shore of False Creek.

Just east of the Station on the northeast corner of Cambie Street & 2nd Ave, we took the pedestrian walkway over the Cambie Street Bridge for a great view of False Creek, Yaletown and the sports stadiums. As the previous slide shows, Olympic Village Station allows for North and South bound tracks.

Very conveniently located, clean, all Compass vendor stands work. Highly recommend!
Great

Coal Harbor is a super special oceanside boardwalk! Feels good, looks clean, nice spots for grub without feeling too touristy and you can buy cool maritime goods at Wrights floating store. Hangout at Coal Harbor for a change instead of English Bay.
View of the lake and mountains in the background. Can watch the sea planes take off and land. Quite scenic and relaxing.
Good day for a nice walk the view so gorgeous I enjoyed it

Visit somewhere each time you can.
If you don't Discover something New go back and look at the View
It’s so clean port city with mountain and sea port view together
Dr. Farah Sayani is very personable and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend her to anyone!
Highly recommended. The people are wonderful and provide you with the services you need!
Farah is an amazing Chiropractor! She is extremely knowledgeable about muscular ramifications affecting skeletal dysfunction in my opinion. I am thankful for Farah. Lynn is awesome too!
I've been having back pain for months.  Dr. Sayani educated me and with just a few treatments my back is feeling better than ever!  Highly Recommended!

Dr. Farah Sayani is very friendly and knowledgeable and although I found the  adjustments to be too short and not nearly thorough enough, I was generally happy with her as my chiropractor. However, do not expect them to be accommodating with appointments. This morning, my meeting ran late so I called the clinic when I was less than a block away to apologize that I'd be 5 minutes late. But instead of trying to accommodate me, I was immediately forced to reschedule since they book appointments 10-15 minutes apart. Wow. Okay, so I wrote an email stating my concern and instead of trying to make amends, the reply was simply "I'm sorry to hear this. We've always booked patients 10-15 minutes intervals." I like Dr. Sayani but not impressed with the clinic.
Statue just outside the giftshop entrance

A lovely art gallery in downtown Vancouver! They keep the place very clean and open with limited number of visits per day and time slot, making it very safe to visit during COVID. I truly enjoyed my visit here.

Not only is this an incredible Art Gallery always full of fascinating and historic art, but it has a gorgeous brand new area in the front of it off of Georgia.  You can sit relaxe, even lay down on grassy patches, with the incredible lion statues!  It's also a terrific place for groups to gather for their presentations and speeches!

had a great time. lots of different kind of artwork on display. I would've liked to see more modern contemporary art, and paintings. but overall it was really interesting and intellectually stimulating! Tuesdays 5-8pm is admission by donations, $5 or $10, the place may be a little busier but it's a steal of a deal. go check it out!
This is place is awful. A very small collection of the most uninteresting items.  Such a nice building is going to waste.
Lovelt place to spend your Saturday

This park is located in the heart of yaletown. It has a large grass area to play or relax. The seawall goes along the bottom of the park with nice views of false creek from downtown across the water. There is the roundhouse community center there as well.  In June( I believe) both David lam park and the roundhouse community center are one of the venue's of the Vancouver jazz festival. All the performances in David lam park are free. So a great place to go sit on the grass have something to eat and listen to live music. The rest of the year it's pretty calm, but a popular spot for yaletown residents. Also it's one of a few places in Vancouver you can get away from the homelessness that has completely taken over the rest of the city. Like all Vancouver parks there is no smoking in the park, but there are benches littered around the park some slightly removed so is totally fine to stop have a beer or smoke a joint and nobody is going to bother you.
A great park. Lots of amenities, but oh boy does it get packed when it's nice out!
Wide open park where you can look out at the seawall. Why am I reviewing another park I don't know but yeah it's alright.
Great park. Used to be better before the homeless invasion but still great.

This park is just amazing. Come enjoy the park!😊✌🏻
Love Stanley Park during the daytime. Didn't love the parking fees, but there are so many other options other than cars to get out and enjoy this beautiful place. Try using bus, or bike/walk/jog/skate the sea wall.
Love the lighthouse and look out. Beautiful view of Ocean, North Shore, Lions Gate Bridge, and Vancouver.
Love the miniature train, horse drawn carriage & lots of amazing locations for photography.  📸

If I have one complaint about Stanley Park is that it's busy to get out of the park back through downtown. But that is definitely warranted as it is always absolutely beautiful here. The views of Vancouver and all around the park are always stunning and you could literally spend hours here being active or even just relaxing with your family or friends. Such a wonderful Park to visit

Amazing place to visit with family and friends! You can do a lot of fun activities here and you'll surely love the majestic view of the place. Perfect place to watch the sunset and walk around the area. You'll see people walking, riding their bikes and most of them are watching the views. I highly recommend this place to visit!

Welcome to Stanley Park, Vancouver's first, largest, and most beloved urban park!
Stanley Park is a magnificent green oasis in the midst of the urban landscape of Vancouver.
Explore the 400-hectare natural West Coast rainforest and enjoy scenic views of water, mountains, sky, and majestic trees along Stanley Park's famous Seawall. Discover kilometres of trails, beautiful beaches, local wildlife, great eats, natural, cultural and historical landmarks, along with many other adventures. The park offers a wide range of unforgettable experiences for all ages and interests, including Canada’s largest aquarium.
Vancouver parks are open from 6am to 10pm unless otherwise posted, and access to washrooms is available from dusk until dawn.

￼

Getting here

Walk, bike, take transit, or drive — find simple directions, along with maps to find parking, things to do and see, and trails to explore.

￼

Great place to walk, jog, cycling, picnic and hanging out with friends. One of my most favourite park that I have visited till date. Provide you with a great view of ocean, bridge. Have best Aquarium in Vancouver😍

My 16 yrs old daughter went to an all ages event at this club. She went with a group of friends and had a really positive "first nightclub" experience. The staff were professional and sensitive to the needs of their guest.

My daughter left her coat in the coat check. I was able to get in touch with the Manager and he took a personal interest in getting her coat back to us.

I have no reservations in recommending this business.

Mark this point, from here up are storefront that are quite nice, behind and back down to the SkyTrain station is gross sidewalk with homeless and druggies. Vancouver is overrated AF. Expect people on the street yelling and trying to pick fights.
It does make the area nicer and classy. I just wish it showed the right time and it worked.
It's a clock, what can I say.
I’m just amazed at all the beauty here in Vancouver. Especially with all the fall color. Being from San Diego, we love the ocean, and a chance to walk the sea wall was gorgeous.

Relaxing walks or how ever you want to go around. We usually walk around whole Stanley Park and it is clean with nice views around the city and the ocean. Plentiful of benches to sit and relax the whole 9km.
Whether you are a local or a tourist, I recommend visiting the seawall for a walk, stroll, bike ride, jog, run, etc. all year round.  The fresh air and scenic views are relaxing and therapeutic.

it's a long walk is you would like to do the whole trail, so I recommend to bring a bike or rent one and also much better in the summer. It can be a little chilly down there in the winter months but if you don't mind cold it still is a beautiful spot for a little beach walk.
Closed to bikes due to covid...all biking is done on Stanley park drive (not safe for kids)
Cool place to visit and hangout. Lots of games to play. Large bar. Super awesome staff. Decent price drinks 4.50 shots of fireball. Good music. Will definetly back on date nights with the wifey.

Really nice place with a nice crowd inside. Had nice and cheap drink. BUT we were there at karaoke night and we weren't allowed to sing a german song. Waited almost 1 1/2 hours for our song and everyone was able to sing before us!!

One of my more favorite dive bars. The place has a nice atmosphere with some games set up in the back like giant jenga, beer pong, and giant connect 4. When you have a group of friends it it keeps you occupied than just drinking and dancing (the later is something I don’t really like doing). Drinks are moderately priced but taste pretty good, I like the gin and tonic.

What a great bar in gas town...that a bar  selling great beer  the  hotel upstairs pretty cool other than that we had an enjoyable evening prices were great

Allan Robertson

Everything was fine until we decided to do karaoke. The bartender was amazing and very attuned to our needs. Once we decided to do karaoke, the guy in charge kept hitting on my sister in law and refused to put us on the list when he found out she was married. He continued to block us from karaoke the entire night. I’m extremely disappointed in the events that transpired tonight.

6623.name: Mobi Bike Station 0153 - Arbutus Greenway & Fir

reviews.text: Bikes available.
A must visit sunset view
I go here for overcrowded beaches and sunsets.

Great morning! Went for a bike ride around Stanley Park and ended up on Sunset Beach. I would highly recommend this beach and the  surrounding area for either a walk on the various walk ways and paths..or bike ride on either side of False Creek area.
Just down the road u can take a ferry across that will get u to Granville Isand for a selection of nice places to eat. As well there is a winding path way along the water at Granville Island on False Creek that leads youto the end by SCIENCE World. Lots to see and do. A must see for tourists.

Good beach but water is sometimes sus. If you want good water quality for swimming, go to second or third beach. Great for sand or grass activities due to large amounts of FLAT area (no slopes, no tree roots). The roller hockey rink and skateboarding area are great too. Watch for police on bikes looking to poor out alcohol on a warm Friday night.

This is a fantastic park. It's a Vancouver milestone if your asking me. The planetarium close by. Kits beach just off your shoulder. And a great beach, board walk. Gotta love our home!! We are lucky. Let's celebrate that, in a humble and safe way though.

Started going there back in the 90s when it was open for lunch and still go today. Best strip club service I've had. Friendly staff, and even friendlier girls. I love the atmosphere of the place. Brings back memories of my 20s. I love the variety of dancers there. There is someone for everyone. Always have had a great time there. Great downtown Vancouver location, within walking distance of many hotels. After midnight the place is packed with dancers and guys. A pretty varied clientele from business men to bachelor parties and birthday parties and MANY Americans who make the journey up to experience what a strip club should be. I have no complaints and will remain a regular. The best experience I've ever had was at the Penthouse. Thanks Tasha

The penthouse has the best staff in Vancouver. The other week I forgot my jacket and I was able to get it back hassle free. Can’t thank them enough for the friendly service. On top of that Matt and Ben, the bartenders, are fast and knowledgeable.
Curbside dances sounds like a wonderful idea!!!
It was ok. Closed now.
SOme of the hottest dancers in Vancouver.. for a more intimate experience i would recommend the Paramount on Columbia

Before heading to a concert recently I had heard only rumours. The show lived up to every rumour I heard, sound was great, atmosphere was top notch and the show was first class. I would go again and would recommend this venue to anyone looking for a top quality concert.

Been to this venue a few times over the years. It's always been a pleasure. The stage, dance floor and sound are all excellent. I really enjoy the atmosphere and the seating and bar offer good options for those that attend.

Look forward to more shows in the future.

Such a cool place to watch live shows!
Lots of bars to grab drinks and there is both seated options with tables and standing areas so no matter what you’ll have a great time.
Acoustics are okay, definitely could be better sometimes but overall I’ve loved every concert I’ve been to here

Hands down, without a doubt, holding down all 3 podium spots - this venue is the BEST IN VANCOUVER for seeing a show / any kind of live music! Intimate but large enough to feel comfortable (helps having tires in the floor for a little extra bounce too!). From Kid Cudi to Griz, and about a dozen others in between, this place rocks!!

This is one of my absolute favourite venues in Vancouver!! It's intimate enough to get right to the front of the stage and see the sweat flying off the performer, but big enough to find a cozy nook on the top floor to listen to the show in comfort. They even serve food in the early evening! The seating is tiered around the floor so that no matter where you are, you can see the stage (if you choose to sit), but there is no designated seating so one can wonder around where they like. Concerts are just the best here!
Fantastic!  My son's been going since 3.5 years old, and he's now 8.  Hope they grow with the community and be able to offer more diversified courses.  :)
Drama class is fantastic, it’s my daughter’s favorite.
terrible, they made us keep paying and every time we would pay again (when we didn’t need to) they would tell us we didn’t pay the last time.
Best staff ever! Georgia Main Rocks!!!
Recent navy got😂
Best fish and chips ever!!!!
Great vibe and location, awesome live music and Granville island parking is free afterhours so you can enjoy your evening events!
Fun little night club right by the water at the art of Granville island. Always loved it when The Phonix Band plays there.
Food okay but love the music and drink.

We saw a fantastic band called Ardent Tribe one night. The sound system was great and not so loud that it distorted sound. The staff were very nice. Only downside is the kitchen closed 8 and we arrive 10 minutes after
Wow.....nuff said

Beautiful beach, water was warmer than most other beaches in the area. Excellent for young kids to play and adults to relax. Almost zero waves allowed for a nice nap aboard an inflatable boat not too far from the beach, not much noise and the water movement was very relaxing! 😎

Easy to access, lots of variety in terms of areas to hang out. The sand is GORGEOUS and I highly recommend walking barefoot on the rocks too - sandstone is so grippy!

Saw lots of anemones and an otter!!

This place is wonderful.  Crystal clear water, white sand, beautiful rock formations.  High, high, amounts of people though so you really have to be conscious to keep Covid distancing.
What a magical place for a freeing swim!

Absolutely gorgeous beach, one of the most stunning I've ever seen. Water can some days in the summer be warm enough to swim, crystal clear water, and sandy beaches. Beach can get busy though and the available outhouses aren't great.
Personally, I prefer walking around Science World rather than going inside it. Its spot on the seawall is pretty prime so it’s easy to arrive there and get lost watching the world go by.

Awesome for all ages. They have adult nights and serve liquor. They also have murder mystery nights! So fun! Even on a regular day there is a lot to play with and learn. I love doing the puzzles!  The IMAX is great!! Love the movies and docs they show!

Watch out for impark because if you go over your time, it's a 65 dollar fine. Total rip off because what you pay to get in Science World parking should be free. I would also like to add that you don't have to pay fines on private lots. Just be sure to change your license plate so if you park there again you don't get towed.

It was great. Although the pandemic has really strained the fun and involvement we can have, things just aren't the same. I understand they need to maintain the establishment but during this time I feel as if the price should drop as a lot of things were not open.
It wad a wonderful experience to look at exhibit' s and watch demonstrations at the centre stage.

Peter was very helpful in answering all my questions via email before making the trek to the island to see the bike in person. Once I arrived everything was in order for me to take a test ride and Peter had printed out the full service history on the pre owned motorcycle I was interested in.

I was impressed how quickly they decided to replace the battery without me asking as they said it tested low on the voltage.

Upon the completion of the sale we discovered a small problem with a light switch and they once they diagnosed the exact problem they quickly arranged for me to take the bike to their other location in Victoria where they had the part in stock.
Bernie was waiting for me and had the switch replaced in 15 minutes, I was off to the ferry after that.

Overall a very pleasant transaction, they truly care about their customers.

Buyer be aware, whatever advertised price you see, you'll be surprised with an additional undisclosed $920 that is far higher "Doc fee" than you'll see in other dealership ($500 higher than the highest in BC). Explanation? As dismissing and very eloquently the managers said: This is the cost of doing business here, take it or leave it. And here's your deposit back.

Don't tell me that it's because it's more expensive to ship bikes to the island. That's BS. The freight fee covers that, and it is a separate Addl $800 that I didn't argue. The "Admin fee" which is a made up fee to cover paperwork is what's obscene.

The greed is outstanding if on top of a +$14k motorcycle sale, you still try to squeeze few hundreds of more...

Definitely unhappy that my credit was credit was pulled before these fees were disclosed, and even more upset on how I was dismissed over the phone by who ever runs the place. It's getting harder to find any honest customer oriented triumph dealerships these days.

Very unimpressed.

The staff in the service dep't are EXTREMELY knowledgeable in all things BMW.  Always nice to deal with true professionals!     Communication is excellent and honest and they kept me up to speed regularly with phone calls, emails and the use of pictures.  My experience was so good I am considering shipping my motorcycle 2500 kms to them for it's 10,000 km service.

Best customer service I have ever experienced from a  dealership! Great experience from beginning to end without none of that awkward wheeling and dealing that usually comes with purchasing a vehicle. I can tell that the owner Tom truly cares about building lasting customer relationships. Highly recommended for those who are on the market for a motorcycle!!

The team at Island BMW is always so great to deal with, had my Ducati’s services here many times and purchased my latest bike from them. Always above expectation, and today was no exception. I had an issue with my daily commuter this morning, called Bernie and even though they were fully booked for a week, he told me to swing by. He understood how much I need my bike to get to and from work and had a tech check it out, fixing the problem, in less than 30min! Highly recommended!!
Small gallery, not many thinga to see. Interesting nevertheless.
I hope they could have a bigger space in the future, always a great spot to go when you want to see some art.
This tiny art gallery offers cutting edge exhibitions that will make you think and get ya right in the feels.

It was much smaller than I expected, but admission is free/by donation. I enjoyed going through the exhibits. It's a quick cultural stop among shopping/eats nearby on Granville - It would probably take 20 min to go through everything.
Interesting exhibits.  Sponsors exhibits at other locations eg transit busses
beautiful scenery
I love this place...the views, the old, the all atmosphere is so magical here! I wish all the have the opportunity to visit and enjoy..till then...enjoy these pics
This place has it all--wonderful in every season.  Sometimes a little too crowded on summer Saturdays... depending on your preferences.
love it
Absolutely Breathtaking~

The bikes and the app itself are unbelievably in bad conditions! I aimed to used these bikes 3 times, the first time there was a problem with the app that it was not able to unlock the bike and I had to try 4 different bikes to be able to ride. The second time the app assumed that the bike was unlocked and started the trip but the lock was not opened, I could not even end the trip because the application thought it was unlocked. The third time I was able to unlock the bike but the wheel was broken or something that I could not even ride it, so I immediately ended the trip and of course I was charged for the whole hour! And there is no number to reach them to report anything. I had to reply to the email that I sent the previous time and wait a couple of days until they respond back.
Super convenient and easy to use in Waterloo! A lot more affordable than renting a bike for a semester.
2 terrible experiences, both app related. Do not recommend loading any of your money. Kingston should look to Bixi Bikes as they know what they're doing.
This is simply horrible. Awful bikes and terrible app. Just can't end a trip I couldn't take. It deserves no stars. Their costumer service doesn't exist. Stay away!
Would have given less than 1 star. I unlocked a bike that was broken, locked it back in a couple of minutes and still cannot end the trip. App is buggy, do not give them your money.
The employees are very kind and the art exhibition was fantastic 😍
Amazing place to spend your night
10/10. Best customer service and flavors. Only hookah lounge my friends and I go to.
First time and an amazing experience! Riz was so helpful and happy to answer any questions and provide great advice. Great atmosphere,  the drinks were delicious and will definitely be coming back.
The names Bond James Bond, Lady Sieda lost her charm.I responded not from where I'm standing. Good times!
Ordered the orange fresh today with an ice hose and it was perfect as usual, love coming here. Makes me feel like I’m at home
The Sidekick Players Club productions never disappoint! 4 shows a year, between 9 and 11 performances of each show. Don't miss them!
Beautifully designed and decorated. The building is a work of art in itself.
Why not enjoy a glass of wine and a show with or without a date!
Saw the play The Best Brothers! Wonderful show!!!
I really like it here.  The building is such an original work of art.  I've taken part in many good programmes here and have done some performing here too.

13483.name: TwinStar Credit Union Hawks Prairie Safeway

reviews.text: All City Athletics is more than just a boxing club...its a community, a lifestyle! The private training session with Anna was such a blast and extremely helpful in teaching me the basics as a beginner and ensuring that I have proper technique. As for the group sessions, you really can't top the workout you get. The instructors are all phenomenal and unique in their own special ways, which makes each class different, yet as effective as the others. Joining All City has had a major positive impact on my life both physically and mentally and it's safe to say that I'm hooked! I would highly recommend it to anyone, whether beginner or expert.

I've completed 5 classes (2 intro + 3 eight count) with various instructors. Loved every class! Such a good workout. The staff & instructors are so friendly & knowledgeable. My teenager came to an eight count class with me & he loved it too. I would highly recommended All City Athletics.

Highly recommend! I just completed my two week intro and will be staying around for more! The instructor’s are great at keeping you motivated and the community is welcoming to both beginners and pro’s. A great challenge in each class! Make sure to bring your sweat towel ; )

Everyone who works here is a genuinely good human.  They answer questions with patience.  They support your growth.  They help you improve.  Overall, they care about you.  And that's a wonderful environment to have when you're trying to make some changes in your life.  If you've never boxed before, this place is the perfect place to start.

As someone who had never previously tried boxing, I was a bit nervous to jump in. But within the first few classes, I saw a major improvement in my overall conditioning and technique. The instructors are all world class and make an effort to get to know each person's names and connect with them. Overall, I was blown away by the experience and absolutely love the culture and energy the team at All City bring day in and day out.
I didn't spend much time there...

Great ocean (inlet) view.  Long sandy beach with posts for volleyball nets,  then interesting boulders, logs and streams to scramble over further down from the access.  There are paved parking lots, trails, and public washrooms. It was also deserted but Ive only been at night after 8PM.
I have slept  here!
Try another place to visit
Its abite over run with homeless people but still an ok park in the day time hours

Have given my watch to them for a simple repair on pins which have come loose. As this is a Birks branded watch I felt it would be a great option. They said they no longer fix in store, they send to Montreal. This was given to them Oct 2 and promised back latest Nov 2. After hearing nothing I then called, they didn’t seem to be able to track the ticket at first; the rep left a voicemail two days later saying it would be an additional 4 weeks. Now we have surpassed that and are coming up on 2 months for pins to be fixed. I’m extremely unsatisfied with the service, organization of their repairs and the timeline and lack of follow up. I will say however the Birks watch is older, durable, still stylish and has always worked incredibly well for me. As a purchase it was fantastic.
Very posh. Do great work with jewelry that lasts a lifetime! Good customer service!

Very happy with my experience. The manager Jayne was very friendly and knowledgeable. She helped me find the right watch which was very important to me. That is a big reason why I am beyond satisfied. They definitely will be getting my business again.
Very nice store. Historic Canadian business in heart of Vancouver's downtown.

I will review the Oakridge Vancouver store here as well since the store is closing soon. They get a 4.5. I originally called the Oakridge store about 18 k earrings out of stock online.  They found 1 stud at Park Royal and another at the downtown Vancouver store.  Over the phone, they helped me special-transfer ordered them to Oakridge. This was five star service. They lost marks for not telling explicitly telling me how the pouch worked (I thought I lost an earring) and for not telling me how to tighten the butterfly backing (I lost a backing on day 5). Maybe it's common knowledge...I have no clue since I haven't worn earrings in 20+ years due to ear lobe infections.

Due to COVID hour changes, I couldn't call in for help until day 7. Oakridge said they would've replaced for free but they had no stock since they were in the process of closing (Oakridge area rejuvenation project). Park Royal said they do not have any replacements and would charge to order one.  Dwntown Vancouver said that if they had a replacement in store they would replace for free or special order one for a fee.

After a 40 min trip...

1. A Birk representative opened the door in and out, so I didn't have to touch the handles

2. Inside it was spacious, bright, and clean.

3. The Birk representative inside was super friendly and helpful.  He found the replacement and taught me how to tighten the butterfly backing.

4.  He showed me another variety of earrings and there was no sales pressure.

The downtown location gets 5 stars. Wonderful service considering I didn't buy from their location.

I'm so glad I went with Birks.  It was really hard finding a store I trusted that carried quality 18k earrings. I'm also glad I didn't go with an online only store.

I am already eyeing their pearls and Muse earrings. Will come back to this location whenever possible.

Happy customer.
The Lion Clock was donated by the Hong Kong expatriate community Lions Club to the city of Vancouver.
It a clock

16371.name: Herman Ottó Környezetvédelmi és Mezőgazdasági Szakgimnázium, Szakközépiskola és Kollégium

reviews.text: Every now and then everyone has a fleeting idea of something great, amazing that they might do.. and then don't do it. Well these guys do it, and do it well, and then top that with something more amazing than anyone expected. Continual improvement and making the unbelievable seem possible. Cant wait to see what they come up with in the future.

Stuart Ward and Ben Cooper are outstanding, driven and creative individuals.  If you're on an awards committee you should really consider H4.  If you're trying to blow people's minds with an event or a new product, hire them.  If you're looking for artists who can work on enormous scale and leave a lasting impression, this is your team.

Transformation Projects has had nothing but a positive experience in working with H4.  Knowing that they'll deliver on time on on budget is always nice; but having wizards of light and unending genius on our team is actually really exciting.  To round it out, Stuart and Ben are professional, easy to work with and rock a sense of humour which is the fuel to the long hours of festival and event production work.

Great professionals for any interactive experiential activations, or just cause you like beautiful light shows!

Perfect for immersive brand activation, or more permanently for beatifull unique art pieces.

Their attention to details and finishing, makes for a very reliable way to Woa your guests every time while the scalability of their offering is only limited by your budget.

Chances are, you already have been exposed to their work... and if not, you should!

Altogether a truly unforgettable opportunity to have attended some of Hfour's installations.

Impressive use of media, light and design to create uniquely immersive experiences: sublime production values with a sense of cohesion and continuity that are hard to match.

Looking forward to seeing your future projects, Hfour! And love the showreel on your website.

Thank you.

These guys are pro's at making people say WOW!
The digital magic coming from this vancouver studio is top notch.
Love to shop at my home depot great deals
I don't know why?
Great place, but they really need to do something about the vampire population here. The Tremere run everything and they have no sense of imagination.
It's a great space for events
It is going to be torn down and rebuilt
